name: fasterq-dump

options.description: full path of outputfile (overrides usage of current directory and given accession)
path for outputfile (overrides usage of current directory, but uses given accession)
size of file-buffer (dflt=1MB, takes number or number and unit where unit is one of (K|M|G) case-insensitive)
size of cursor-cache (dflt=10MB, takes number or number and unit where unit is one of (K|M|G) case-insensitive)
memory limit for sorting (dflt=100MB, takes number or number and unit where unit is one of (K|M|G) case-insensitive)
path to directory for temp. files (dflt=current dir.)
show progress (not possible if stdout used)
print details of all options selected
writes single reads into special file
writes whole spots into one file
use rowid as name (avoids using the name column)
which seq-table to use in case of pacbio
filter output by matching against given bases
append to output-file, instead of overwriting it
switch to control: on=perform size-check (default), off=do not perform size-check, only=perform size-check only
explicitly set disk limit for temp. files
Display the version of the program
Increase the verbosity of the program status messages. Use multiple times for more verbosity.
Logging level as number or enum string. One of (fatal|sys|int|err|warn|info|debug) or (0-6) Current/default is warn
Read more options and parameters from the file.

tldr:
> Extracts data in FASTQ- or FASTA-format from SRA accessions.
> More information: <https://github.com/ncbi/sra-tools/wiki/HowTo:-fasterq-dump>

- Download the SRA data that has accession SRR1553607.

`fasterq-dump {{SRR1553607}}`

- Download the SRA data and specify the location of the output

`fasterq-dump {{SRR000001}} -O {{/mnt/big_hddq}}`
